answers.answer: Hi there.From your history, it is very hard to point out which one is the real culprit.  I would like to think more of your symptoms as contributions from a variety of factors from your previous ailments, aggravated by the physiologic changes of pregnancy (increased blood pressure, blood volume, hormonal changes, water retention etc).  I suggest you keep a close watch on your pregnancy with regular consults with your obstetrician, and might as well be managed by an internist so that any complications in your pregnancy can be anticipated and addressed.  I hope your pregnancy will be as uneventful as possible.Regards and God bless.

question: 3 yrs ago i delivered @ 28 weeks due to preeclampsia. I was experiencing visual changes ie: sparkles, and distortion...as if one pupil was blown...kinda like looking thru the bottom of a coke bottle with only one eye and the other was fine, auroras and other pre-cursors to migraine...but never got the pain.   Is there any long lasting effects of preeclampsia on the nerology end?   I feel like I am just talking to walls and I get looked at like I have 3 heads!!  I am pregnant again in my 18th weeks and am getting the sparkles, auroras, and every one in a while distorted vision.  My B/P and urine is great.  I also have a history of Crest syndrome, Sjrogren's, 3 DVT's, a PE and a possible TIA.
title: Preeclampsia effects
